subject: AI & Agents
title: Watson Wins Jeopardy!
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Watson Wins Jeopardy!.

hook.text: In 2011, an IBM computer faced Jeopardy! champions Ken Jennings and Brad Rutter. It crushed them both.

buildup.text: Watson combined natural language processing, information retrieval, and confidence scoring.

discovery.text: It parsed tricky clues with puns, wordplay, and cultural references â€” Jeopardy!'s signature difficulty.

twist.text: Watson famously answered 'Toronto' to a US cities clue. Even its failures were spectacular.

climax.text: Ken Jennings wrote on his answer: 'I, for one, welcome our new computer overlords.'

punchline.text: The computer won the game show. Humanity kept its sense of humor.

quiz.question: What was Watson's famous mistake during Jeopardy!?
options: It answered 'Toronto' to a US cities category clue
It refused to answer any questions
It crashed during the final round
